title: A1989 820-00850-A no boot
message:
HI,

I have an A1989 820-00850-A that with the battery connected, it only shows 5V on the ampmetter, but without the battery, with the board only, it shows 19.5V on the amp metter and stays in the Apple logo and has no boot, and no progress bar.

Can you help?

title: A1989 820-00850-A no boot
message:
Hi,
No i didn't try DFU. 
I don't have other A1898 to do DFU. Is ther any other way?

title: A1989 820-00850-A no boot
message:
No need the same machine model.
You can use even non-T2 machine; just need a proper cable.

title: A1989 820-00850-A no boot
message:
OK, thanks. I didn't know that.

Any USB-C to USB-C cable do it, or is a special cable? If so, can you give a link to any one?

title: A1989 820-00850-A no boot
message:
TKS. I'll do so.
Didn't know this "HOW TO COLLECTION". Good initiative!

title: A1989 820-00850-A no boot
message:
HI, 
I've tried the revive option and the restore uption, but with no sucess. Mac still doesn't boot...

title: A1989 820-00850-A no boot
message: Did you get errors in DFU process?

title: A1989 820-00850-A no boot
message:
No error, except the error / warning  saying that a restore must be made, at the end of the restore / revive procedure.
However, right now, whenever i try do dfu again, i can't because it is stuck in recovery mode (but no image on scrren). Even when force shutdown, it always comes back in recovery mode

title: A1989 820-00850-A no boot
message:
Did you read this (recent post, no escuse)?
[URL unfurl="true"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/820-01598-a-dfu-recovery.61560/[/URL]
He managed to switch from recovery to DFU...

title: A1989 820-00850-A no boot
message:
I haven't read it before.

However my problem is different, because i can force the DFU mode, from the recovery state. However, no recovery logo is showed, and when the restore is tried, it gaves an error saying:

"The system canot be restored  on this device. Device added from an invalid state Restoring"

And then  goes to recovery state again by it self

title: A1989 820-00850-A no boot
message:
Try other USB cable, or use another T2 machine.
Test both Catalina and Big Sur on second machine, if you don't know what version was installed on T2 one.

Can you access it in Target Disk mode?

title: A1989 820-00850-A no boot
message:
I can't do nothing on the mac.
The screen is black, and even when I disconnect the batery, i cant select disk or enter in the installation screen (complete black screen), and whenever i conect the cable to the other machine, it is alreay in recovery mode. The second machine, with the Apple Configurator 2,  already is with Big Sur

title: A1989 820-00850-A no boot
message:
After  a while it managed to go to DFU (I don't know why), but when I do the DFU restore, after finishing, it shows a padlock logo and gaves an warning that says:

"Apple controller is not booted. Click restore to update the device to the latest firmware version. This cannot be undone."

When I do the restore again, it happends all the same

title: A1989 820-00850-A no boot
message:
Hi,
 I always get the same error after the DFU restore:
"Apple controller is not booted. Click restore to update the device to the latest firmware version. This cannot be undone." 

Shall i give up on it?

title: A1989 820-00850-A no boot
message: Did you try from Catalina too?
